title: Star Gaurdian Ahri is a Legendary skin.
body:
At least by what the previews show.

For those of you upset by this reveal, you should actually be happy about this bit of news. Why?

Because I doubt we'll see a new skin after this for Ahri for quite some time. I suspect a minimum of 2 years. I know this might be difficult to believe, especially now, but look back on the patterns of releases for skins in the past.

Normally, when Riot makes a really high quality skin, such as a Legendary, they tend to step away from making skins for that champ for quite awhile.

Examples: Master Yi, Ashe, Rumble, Sion, Sona, Nocturne, and Cho'gath; just to name the more obvious ones.

Of course, I can't speak for Riot, for I don't know what they're plans are. But, I can say that I am 90% sure that Star Gaurdian Ahri will be the last Ahri skin we see for a really long time, not only due it being a Legendary, but also due to the sudden outcry over the reveal.

Where do you see "Pool Party Ahri announced" in any of that? 

These are months old posts that go off of nothing but rumors, and fan art. Riot would also never EVER announce something like this a whole _year_ before its release. If they do that, they run into another Ao Shin dilemma, where hype builds up so damn much, that it eventually becomes impossible for them to deliver on said hype, disappointing the majority of the player base in the end.

This is exactly why you never see any announcements from Riot more than 6 months in advance, and if it's for a skin, the only time you will see them before they get on the PBE is if they're leaked, of which, all leaks must be taken with a grain of salt. Sometimes their right, sometimes their wrong, you can never know.

EDIT: That leak was made before 7.12, and "announced" a new champ which _might_ be in production, but if he was meant to come after Kayn, or, even _be_ Kayn, it was completely wrong.

Also, the leak happened when Star Guardian Ahri should have been in production. It is a legendary skin, so, that means they probably started working on it around January/February, if not earlier.
